frameDefinitions: This frame covers a step in a criminal process in which a  Judge decides whether the Accused should be released on bail, and, if so, what the amount of the bail should be.  '' 'Thorsen, of Grimstad, Norway, was granted $100,000 bail until June 18.'
A speaker characterizes the intensity of an Attribute of an Entity by a Degree.
A Fugitive avoids recapture by or on the authority of Authorities in relation to a Crime which the Fugitive has committed or is suspected of having committed.
The Connector is an artifact created to affix a Connected_item or to bind onto a Fixed_location and is primarily so used.

The judge or other court officer (the Authority) informs the Accused of the Charges against him/her, i.e. the alleged actions and the relevant laws. '' 'The board has been accused by the federal court of making decisions based on narrow agendas and meddling where it shouldn't.'
A particular Binding_principle is (or is not) operative, that is, any obligations, restrictions, and any other aspects of the Binding_principle are (or are not) in effect.
frameExamples: Thorsen, of Grimstad, Norway, was granted $100,000 <t>bail</t> until June 18.
He is in fact a <t>fugitive</t> of the law and you must inform the police if you see him.
A waterproof <t>adhesive</t> should be used for this exterior job.
The board has been <t>accused</t> by the federal court of making decisions based on narrow agendas and meddling where it shouldn't.
This law will only become in <t>effect</t> during the last three weeks of the year.
listRoleDefinitions: At the time of bail setting, the <fen>Accused</fen> is held without bail/bond, released on his/her own recognizance, or required to give the Court  a specific amount of money for bail.
The <fen>Judge</fen>, as head of  the Court, determines the <fen>Accused</fen>'s bail.
<fen>Status</fen> idenitifies the decision made with regard to bail.  The possible statuses are 'without bail/bond', 'on one's own recognizance', or a specific amount of money required for bail.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the bail setting occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the bail setting occurs.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which a particular gradable <fen>Attribute</fen> is appropriate and under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the intensity of the <fen>Attribute</fen> from the norm or from the value for another <fen>Entity</fen>. This role is incorporated for each LU in this frame.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Value</fen> for the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> is has the <fen>Attribute</fen> to a given <fen>Degree</fen>.
The <fen>Fugitive</fen> has escaped and/or is evading capture by law enforcement <fen>Authorities</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fugitive</fen> is evading law enforcement.
This role identifies the general <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Fugitive</fen> is located.
<fen>Connector</fen> identifies the entity or substance that forms the bond that maintains the <fen>Item</fen> in a fixed position; it is usually expressed in a 'with'-PP.
The judge or other authority of the court in which the accused person is arraigned.
The person being charged with an offense against the law.
The crime with which the Accused is charged
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is the law, contract, principle, or other (set of) obligations that is (or is not) operational.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is in effect.
The <fen>Place</fen> at which the <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is or is not operational.
listRoleExamples: Judge Duncan fixed <fex>the doctor's</fex> bail at one million dollars.
<fex>Judge Duncan</fex> fixed the doctor's bail at one million dollars.
Judge Duncan fixed the doctor's bail <fex>at one million dollars</fex>.
Only two years earlier <fex>she</fex> had been on the lam from charges of embezzlement.
He was a fugitive <fex>in the early 1990s</fex>.
Sloan, on the lam <fex>in Michigan</fex> for the last five months, is due to appear in court this Monday.
The robber tied Harry to the chair with a <fex><t>rope</t></fex>.
Once <fex>the treaty</fex> is in effect, US port authorities and the Coast Guard will monitor compliance by checking any yacht 79 feet or longer.
All patent applicants and owners should be aware of the current uncertainty as to what patent fees will be in effect <fex>on October 1, 1998</fex>
This promotion is void <fex>in the state of Florida</fex>.
